overview: The Patagonia without Dams Horseback Ride that took place in late November 2007 in the Aysen Region. Martin Keoken traveled for nine days with more than a hundred riders, covering the 320 kilometers that separate Cochrane from Coyhaique. The production shows unprecedented events of the feat organized by the region's inhabitants to express their rejection of the multiple dam projects projected in Aysen and Patagonia in general, referring to the fact that ultimately these initiatives are driven and decided by economic interests.
title: Aysén Decides
